title: Patient Name
content: Prado
instruction: Only return the patients name and not the doctors name or anyone else's name

title: Chief Complaint
content: Right leg pain with weakness and recurrent falls due to lumbar stenosis
instruction: Please provide only the patient's chief complaint without any additional details or context. Avoid direct speech.

title: History of Present Illness
content: The patient reports persistent right leg pain localized to the anterior thigh, associated with weakness in the right quadriceps, noted as 2/5 strength. She describes a history of progressive difficulty with ambulation, including an inability to fully straighten the right leg. The symptoms began around late June 2023, with worsening over the past three months. She has experienced 16 falls during this period, including a recent fall down the stairs. The patient reports that the pain is exacerbated by standing or walking and is relieved by rest. She has been unable to drive due to lack of control and requires bracing for mobility. She has attempted physical therapy and a corticosteroid injection for tendon inflammation, which provided no lasting benefit. The patient also reports ongoing back pain, which she attributes to her history of metastatic breast cancer to the bones, diagnosed in 2018. She has been under oncologic follow-up and is currently undergoing surveillance with a PET scan scheduled for August 24, 2023, to assess for disease progression. She previously declined a vertebroplasty procedure due to radiation therapy requirements, which delayed intervention. The patient is concerned about the risk of fracture and is currently receiving bone-modifying therapy. She is emotionally distressed by her declining mobility and the burden of care on her husband, who is unable to assist with ambulation despite being able to drive. She has recently hired help for household tasks due to functional limitations.
instruction:
Provide a detailed summary of the patient's current illness based on their report. Include a thorough description of symptoms, noting their onset, duration, and severity or intensity. Discuss any changes or developments in symptoms since their onset and identify factors that may exacerbate or relate to these symptoms, such as specific activities, foods, or medications. Document any prior treatments or remedies the patient has attempted, noting their efficacy. Describe how these symptoms impact the patient's daily activities, overall well-being, and quality of life. Capture information about any individuals mentioned by the patient, specifying their relationship and any pertinent interactions or conversations related to the illness.

Please recheck the sentence and correct any grammatical errors in the following medical-related template. Ensure clarity, professionalism, and proper medical terminology while maintaining a concise and structured format 

End the sentence with period. Avoid direct speech and avoid talking in first person.

title: Past Medical History
content: Breast cancer diagnosed in 2010, with recurrence in the bones in 2018. Currently under oncologic surveillance. History of lumbar spinal stenosis at L3-4 with progressive neurological deficits. Previous failed corticosteroid injection for suspected tendon inflammation. History of multiple falls with concern for fracture risk.
instruction: Should include a comprehensive overview of the patient's previous medical conditions, surgeries, and significant health events.Any chronic or significant medical conditions the patient has been diagnosed with in the past, such as diabetes, hypertension, asthma, heart disease, etc.Any previous surgeries the patient has undergone in the past, including the type of surgery, date, and outcomes. Any previous hospital admissions, not related to the present illness, including the reason for admission, dates, and outcomes. Do not include current visits doctors assessment and plan in this section. This can include the assessments and plans of the previous doctors visits.

title: Current Medications
content: Bone-modifying therapy (specific name not stated) for metastatic breast cancer to bones, ongoing.
Pain medication (specific name not stated), currently being used for symptom control.
instruction: Document the patient's current medications in the following format: Begin with the full generic name of each medication, followed by the brand name in parentheses if applicable (e.g., "Aspirin (Bayer)"). Specify the dosage strength (e.g., "81 mg") and indicate the frequency of administration (e.g., "Once daily"). Describe the route of administration, such as oral, topical, or by injection (e.g., "Oral Aspirin"). Lastly, for ongoing medications, note the duration for which the patient has been taking each medication (e.g., "on Aspirin for 3 weeks"). If no current medications are reported, document "No current medications found."

title: Family History
content: No significant family history of cancer, cardiovascular disease, or neurological disorders reported.
instruction: Extract the family history details shared by the patient. Specify the relation of the family members to the patient and include the age at diagnosis or occurrence of any significant health issues if mentioned. If no relevant family history is provided, default to "No family history found.

title: Social History
content: Married, spouse is able to drive but unable to assist with ambulation due to prior injury (Vietnam-era trauma). Patient is the primary caregiver. Recently hired help for household tasks including cleaning and cooking due to functional decline. Lives independently. No tobacco, alcohol, or illicit drug use reported.

title: Lab Results
content: PET scan scheduled for August 24, 2023, to assess for metastatic disease progression. Previous PET scans in 2023 showed no active disease. MRI of lumbar spine performed, demonstrating L3-4 stenosis with nerve root compression. No recent blood work or lab tests discussed.
instruction: Document the patient's past lab results based on tests previously conducted, as discussed in the conversation. Include the date of each test, the type of test performed (such as blood tests, urine tests, imaging studies like X-rays or MRIs, or other diagnostic procedures), and the specific results reported by the patient. Ensure accuracy and clarity in reporting, focusing solely on tests already completed by the patient. Do not include lab tests prescribed by the doctor during the current visit.

sub-section.title: Assessment
content: L3-4 lumbar spinal stenosis with neurogenic claudication (ICD-10: M48.06)
Right lower extremity weakness due to L3-4 radiculopathy (ICD-10: M54.16)
Metastatic breast cancer to bone, currently stable (ICD-10: C79.51)
History of recurrent falls with risk of fracture (ICD-10: Z98.89)
Functional decline due to neurological and musculoskeletal deficits (ICD-10: Z53.0)
sub-section.instruction: Generate a list of the patient's current medical conditions, Only give all the current assessment and not historical information return it in a list. The result must be easily searchable in icd description so search for the icd code.

sub-section.title: Plan
content: Proceed with surgical intervention for L3-4 spinal stenosis, including decompression and stabilization with instrumentation.
Consider concurrent vertebroplasty or spinal stabilization with cages and screws at the site of vertebral body involvement due to metastatic disease, pending patient consent.
Initiate postoperative rehabilitation program focusing on strengthening and gait training.
Continue current bone-modifying therapy for metastatic disease.
Schedule follow-up imaging (PET scan) on August 24, 2023, to assess for disease activity.
Refer to physical therapy for mobility and fall prevention education.
Provide patient education on surgical risks, benefits, and expected recovery timeline.
Prescribe pain management regimen as needed, including non-opioid and adjuvant therapies.
sub-section.instruction: Detail the healthcare provider's plan of action to manage the patient's condition, specifying treatments, medications (include ongoing medications briefly), procedures, therapies, lifestyle modifications, referrals to specialists, patient education on condition and medications, and recommendations for counselings or support services. Dont provide any follow up details in this section, provide everything in a list.

title: Follow Up
content: Next Appointment: Schedule follow-up for postoperative evaluation and rehabilitation planning.
Review and Adjustments: Plan for reviewing surgical recovery, pain control, and functional status during follow-up appointment.
instruction:
Outline the schedule for follow-up appointments based on the information gathered during the visit. Include the following details if present:
Next Appointment: Schedule the next appointment for [date/time].
Review and Adjustments: Plan for reviewing the patient's progress and making necessary adjustments to the treatment plan during the follow-up appointment.
